text: hi everyone is Helen here today I will
making silver or sticky rice coated in
mung beans this is a very special dish
that we prepare for occasions such as
offerings or new year or yen gatherings
and it's very easy to make so let's
begin to make soy boy you're gonna need
one cup of sticky rice or sweet rice and
half a cup of split peeled mung beans
you can wash them in cold water a few
times until the water runs clear and
then soak in cold water for at least 4
hours about 1/4 cup opting these lights
shallots and you also need some sugar
soft and vegetable oil firstly cook
those soft mung beans
we'll have a cup of water in a rice
cooker until soft take 2 tablespoons of
vegetable oil in a pan and then add in
the tinglies light shallots and fry
until golden brown
when some of the slices John golden brow
is time to turn off the heat and the
remaining heat from the oil will
continue to cook the rest of the slices
after the moon wing is well cooked in
the rice cooker now we're going to
transfer it to a food processor and
process finally after soaking the rice
for four hours drain them completely and
now we're going to add half of the
process mung beans to them glutinous
rice add half a teaspoon of salt give it
a good mix lie your steaming basket with
some banana leaves or a piece of
parchment paper and then pour the rice
in to spread it evenly and make some
holes so the steam can come up
after steaming for about ten minutes
we're gonna add about a tablespoon of
sugar and if you would like you can also
add about 2 to 3 tablespoons of coconut
milk or coconut powder no add too much
coconut milk because it could make the
rice kind of wet then flush the rice
really well with chopsticks and steamed
for another 5 minutes so in total you're
gonna steam the sticky rice for 20
minutes so the sticky rice is well
cooked you know we're gonna transfer it
to a large mixing bowl and then we're
gonna mix it with the fried shallots to
make the glutinous rice more shiny we
can act about a tablespoon or two of
vegetable oil you can use the oil that
will fry the shallots so it's more
fragrant
okay flop the sticky rice really well so
all the rice grain are really separated
it's very very crucial for this dish
that you have all the rice grains
separated now we're going to add the
rest of the mung bean powder into the
rice and mix well
so the mung bean powder will coat it
outside of fish or ice cream that's it
you're done now you can transfer it to a
plate to serve
you can sell this with Vietnamese ham
Cholewa or some caramelized pork belly I
